errors.error_description: The instructions for the long peer setup install `fhempy` globally before creating and activating the virtual environment, which is the wrong order.
correction_candidates: First, install fhempy with `pip3 install --upgrade fhempy`, then create the venv with `python3 -m venv .fhempy/fhempy_venv`, and finally activate it with `source .fhempy/fhempy_venv/bin/activate`.
First, create the venv with `python3 -m venv .fhempy/fhempy_venv`, then activate it with `source .fhempy/fhempy_venv/bin/activate`, and finally install fhempy with `pip3 install --upgrade fhempy`.

First, activate the venv with `source .fhempy/fhempy_venv/bin/activate`, then install fhempy with `pip3 install --upgrade fhempy`, and finally create the venv with `python3 -m venv .fhempy/fhempy_venv`.
First, create the venv with `python3 -m venv .fhempy/fhempy_venv`, then install fhempy with `pip3 install --upgrade fhempy`, and finally activate it with `source .fhempy/fhempy_venv/bin/activate`.
errors.golden_answer: First, create the venv with `python3 -m venv .fhempy/fhempy_venv`, then activate it with `source .fhempy/fhempy_venv/bin/activate`, and finally install fhempy with `pip3 install --upgrade fhempy`.
